intro: Rubentia orientalis, commonly known as the oriental rubentia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Amaryllidaceae. It is native to regions of Central Asia and is characterized by its striking red and orange flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features narrow, grass-like leaves. Its rhizomatous root system allows it to thrive in well-drained soils and full sun conditions. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is more often found in the wild.
